text.__SUMMARY__:
Acacia pravissima, the Ovens wattle or wedge-leaved wattle, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family Fabaceae. It is an evergreen shrub native to Victoria, the South West Slopes and Southern Tablelands of New South Wales, Australia.The Latin specific epithet pravissima means "very crooked".It grows to 5 m (16 ft), producing racemes of ball-shaped yellow flowers in winter and spring.
In temperate regions it is hardy only in mild or warm coastal climates, but must be given a sheltered spot in full sun with neutral or acid soil. Elsewhere it should be grown under glass. This plant has gained the Royal Horticultural Society's Award of Garden Merit.
text.References: R Lancaster, (1998). Plants That Should Be Better Known: Acacia pravissima, Royal Horticultural Society..
